title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to John A. McDonnell, November 9, 1867
summary: Jackson asks McDonnell for advice on how to handle three assault cases against freed blacks, noting high levels of negative feeling towards them. He also mentions James Bumgardner's (Commonwealth Attorney) refusal to prosecute one of the cases.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Legal System, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
